title: President Trump's Big Speech About America
summary: President Donald Trump gave a speech called the State of the Union. He talked about the economy, saying it is doing very well with lower prices for things like gas and medicine. He also praised the U.S. Olympic hockey team and a war hero. But many Americans feel worried about money and don't think Trump's policies have helped them. Polls show that only 39% of people approve of how he handles the economy. Trump also made fun of Democrats in his speech. Republicans wanted him to focus on the economy because elections are coming up. The speech had a happy start but turned more serious later.

background_read: The State of the Union is a yearly speech by the U.S. president to Congress about the country's condition. President Donald Trump gave this speech in 2026. He talked about the economy, which includes things like jobs, prices, and how people spend money. Many Americans were worried about their finances, meaning they felt unsure about having enough money for needs like food and housing. Polls are surveys that ask people questions to find out what they think. Democrats and Republicans are the two main political parties in the United States, and they often disagree on policies.
Article_Structure: WHAT: He gave a State of the Union speech about the economy and praised some people, but many Americans feel worried about money.
WHERE: In Washington, D.C., at the U.S. Capitol.
WHY: To share his view of the economy and prepare for upcoming elections.
